channel.title: Running WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu :Not done: [Update's added]
channel.description:
I need help on this. Some stupid mod on Moparscape/smf is dumb enough to lock a topic, Which There's nothing bad in it. I'm posting here as I can get help, & Owner [MoparistheBest] Is online to help sometimes. I do know this is not done. Well.....I'm new & I'm trying to make a Rs2D on linux. Here's what I will show you so far of what to do. Chapter 1:Installing some programs. Chapter 2:What to do on Terminal, Use ant to run it. Chapter 3:Other stuff to do on the 2nd program. Chapter 4:Running No-IP on Ubuntu. First off.......Eclipse for Ubuntu 8.04 can run Rs2D or WinterLove servers. Running WinterLove on Ubuntu 8.04 on Eclipse is most advanced, has less problems, only one, Logging. I should put this in devolupment, but Really I do not know anyone who has made a server on ubuntu complete, If you did PM Me. Chapter 1: You need to install some programs. Go into terminal, If you don't know where that is, you should not have Linux or even run it. Type in there.
sudo apt-get install ant sudo apt-get install eclipse Now to check ant version and compile do. ant -version
Now we go into Step 2. Chapter 2: Still in terminal do the following. Cd to your current version of Rs2D. Then do [CODE] java net.varek.rs2d.test.Main [/CODE] What this does is Run the RS2D on terminal for the user. Must be in Root Administration account. For me I got this problem. [CODE] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: net.varek.rs2d.test.Main at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.81) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: net.varek.rs2d.test.Main not found in gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader{urls=[file:./], parent=gnu.gcj.runtime.ExtensionClassLoader{urls=[], parent=null}} at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.81) at gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.81) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.81) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.81) at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.81) [/CODE] Chapter 3: That above one was using ANT. Now we are going to use Eclipse, NOT full though. I will show WinterLove steps, as Rs2D has worser problems. press new, then project. Press java project. make a name for it, then press existing folder, go to the WinterLove folder. BAM, Press next after it compiles and then press finish. The better part about Eclipse is it compiles. So If using ant, I use Eclipse for Compiling FAST. now press run Icon, then go into run, press Java Applications. put in SERVER Then your finished, Io & Eventmanager will not work with it. I tested dodian and it worked fine. For that aspect you need to find a way to login without taking the login server out. Chapter 4: Now onto a Beta of Running No-Ip on Ubuntu. First off, I do not still know how to make it show, like windows, But I know how to make it configured meaning running, but not fully done. Go into terminal again. This time type:
Sudo apt-get install no-ip sudo no-ip -C
Me, For my diffrent Ubuntu Linux ways, I have done this as Sudo no-ip -C does not work for my ubuntu, just OpenSUSE. [CODE] noip2 -C [/CODE] That is the newest version. Now you know your No-Ip is running, good for services, but you cannot see it. Thanks, PM Me if you can finish off how to run Either WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu Linux. Using Ant or eclipse, Or how to show the No-Ip on ubuntu, rather than making it run. ~ Banagli Boy.

item.title: Running WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu :Not done: [Update's added]
item.dc:creator: @Bangali_boy Bangali boy
item.description:
@Bangali_boy wrote:

Moparisthebest, I know it’s JAVA.

But I tryed to run it Terminal, Command-Lined, and it gave me the error I stated above.
Can you give us (the Community) the advice bout’ that?

Cause I really really need more help, I use texteditor or EditPlus 3 :).

Read full topic

item.title: Running WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu :Not done: [Update's added]
item.dc:creator: @firewithin3 firewithin3
item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

[quote=“Bangali boy, post:8, topic:246484”]Not many people know how to make an RSPS On ubuntu.

It is very diffrent than Windows.
If you know how to make one please PM Me with it or post it.

I really need to figure it out.[/quote]That’s not true at all, WinterLove or RS2DV don’t use any windows-only apis or libraries, and java is cross-platform. It’s not even making one that you’re having trouble with, you can’t get it running. Once you get the server up and running which is easy enough to do since java is cross-platform, it’s just as easy to code it on ubuntu as it is on vista or xp.

Read full topic
item.source: Running WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu :Not done: [Update's added]

item.title: Running WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu :Not done: [Update's added]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Bangali boy, post:8, topic:246484”]Not many people know how to make an RSPS On ubuntu.

It is very diffrent than Windows.
If you know how to make one please PM Me with it or post it.

I really need to figure it out.[/quote]

Assuming you are writing a server with java, doing it on linux is IDENTICAL to doing it on windows. The only difference is that it will run much, much better on linux.

Don’t run production servers in eclipse, thats a horrible idea. Run them via the command line, with a .sh file (works the same way as a .bat on windows)

Read full topic

item.title: Running WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu :Not done: [Update's added]
item.dc:creator: @Bangali_boy Bangali boy
item.description:
@Bangali_boy wrote:

I need help on this.

Some stupid mod on Moparscape/smf is dumb enough to lock a topic, Which There’s nothing bad in it.
I’m posting here as I can get help, & Owner [MoparistheBest] Is online to help sometimes.
I do know this is not done.

Well…I’m new & I’m trying to make a Rs2D on linux.

Here’s what I will show you so far of what to do.

Chapter 1:Installing some programs.
Chapter 2:What to do on Terminal, Use ant to run it.
Chapter 3:Other stuff to do on the 2nd program.
Chapter 4:Running No-IP on Ubuntu.

First off…Eclipse for Ubuntu 8.04 can run Rs2D or WinterLove servers.
Running WinterLove on Ubuntu 8.04 on Eclipse is most advanced, has less problems, only one, Logging.

I should put this in devolupment, but Really I do not know anyone who has made a server on ubuntu complete, If you did PM Me.

Chapter 1:
You need to install some programs.
Go into terminal, If you don’t know where that is, you should not have Linux or even run it.

Type in there.

sudo apt-get install ant sudo apt-get install eclipse

Now to check ant version and compile do.
ant -version


Now we go into Step 2.

Chapter 2:
Still in terminal do the following.
Cd to your current version of Rs2D.
Then do

java net.varek.rs2d.test.Main

What this does is Run the RS2D on terminal for the user.
Must be in Root Administration account.

For me I got this problem.


Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: net.varek.rs2d.test.Main
   at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.81)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: net.varek.rs2d.test.Main not found in gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader{urls=[file:./], parent=gnu.gcj.runtime.ExtensionClassLoader{urls=[], parent=null}}
   at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.81)
   at gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader.findClass(libgcj.so.81)
   at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.81)
   at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(libgcj.so.81)
   at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run(libgcj.so.81)

Chapter 3:

That above one was using ANT.
Now we are going to use Eclipse, NOT full though.
I will show WinterLove steps, as Rs2D has worser problems.

press new, then project.
Press java project.
make a name for it, then press existing folder, go to the WinterLove folder.

BAM, Press next after it compiles and then press finish.
The better part about Eclipse is it compiles.

So If using ant, I use Eclipse for Compiling FAST.
now press run Icon, then go into run, press Java Applications.
put in SERVER
Then your finished, Io & Eventmanager will not work with it.

I tested dodian and it worked fine.
For that aspect you need to find a way to login without taking the login server out.

Chapter 4:
Now onto a Beta of Running No-Ip on Ubuntu.

First off, I do not still know how to make it show, like windows, But I know how to make it configured meaning running, but not fully done.

Go into terminal again.
This time type:

Sudo apt-get install no-ip

sudo no-ip -C


Me, For my diffrent Ubuntu Linux ways, I have done this as Sudo no-ip -C does not work for my ubuntu, just OpenSUSE. 
noip2 -C

That is the newest version.
Now you know your No-Ip is running, good for services, but you cannot see it.

Thanks, PM Me if you can finish off how to run Either WinterLove or Rs2D on Ubuntu Linux.
Using Ant or eclipse, Or how to show the No-Ip on ubuntu, rather than making it run.

~ Banagli Boy.

Read full topic
